curriculum.title: Systems Thinking on Apple Silicon
curriculum.description: A long-form apprenticeship curriculum focused on durable systems understanding through direct contact with real machines.

phases.title: Observation & Structure
phases.description: Learning to observe artifacts faithfully and recognise structure without interpretation.

phases.title: Execution & State
phases.description: Introducing time, state, and irreversibility through disciplined observation of execution.

phases.title: Processes, Files, and Communication
phases.description: Understanding systems as coordinated entities that interact through files, processes, and networks.

phases.title: Memory & Concurrency
phases.description: Reasoning about correctness under pressure from shared state and concurrent execution.

phases.title: Performance & Architecture
phases.description: Measuring reality and understanding architectural constraints.

phases.title: Specialisation
phases.description: Focused study of GPU programming and graphics systems on Apple Silicon.

courses.title: Hexdump-Lite
courses.subtitle: Seeing Bytes Faithfully
courses.summary: Build a minimal hexdump tool to learn how to observe bytes on disk without interpretation.

courses.title: Binary Shape and Format
courses.subtitle: Declared Structure Without Interpretation
courses.summary: Study binary formats as contracts, learning to recognise declared structure without narrating meaning.

courses.title: pscope
courses.subtitle: Observing Execution Without Trust
courses.summary: Introduce execution as an observable physical process using Dipole to inspect live state without interpretation.

courses.title: Debugging as Reconciliation
courses.subtitle: Reconciling Intent with Observed State
courses.summary: Develop disciplined debugging practices focused on registers, breakpoints, and controlled intervention.

courses.title: Processes, Pipes, and Control
courses.subtitle: Coordinating Programs
courses.summary: Study process lifecycles, pipes, file descriptors, and PTYs to understand how programs coordinate.

courses.title: Filesystems as Contracts
courses.subtitle: Persistence Across Time
courses.summary: Build a small filesystem to understand persistence, metadata authority, and recovery under failure.

courses.title: Networking as a System Boundary
courses.subtitle: Communication Beyond the Local Machine
courses.summary: Explore sockets, protocols, latency, and partial failure through a small networking tool.

courses.title: Memory Is a System
courses.subtitle: Address Spaces and Illusions
courses.summary: Interrogate virtual memory, mappings, and protection to understand when abstractions fail.

courses.title: Concurrency and Ordering
courses.subtitle: Correctness Under Contention
courses.summary: Reason about threads, scheduling, atomicity, and memory models using tracing and visualisation.

courses.title: Measuring Reality
courses.subtitle: Performance as Observation
courses.summary: Build profiling tools to measure real systems behaviour and avoid misleading intuition.

courses.title: Apple Silicon Architecture
courses.subtitle: Understanding the Machine You Are Standing On
courses.summary: Study ARM64 execution, caches, pipelines, and speculation as architectural constraints.

courses.title: GPU Programming on Apple Silicon
courses.subtitle: Coordinated Parallel Execution
courses.summary: Investigate GPU execution and CPU/GPU coordination through Metal compute workloads.

courses.title: Graphics Systems with Metal
courses.subtitle: Rendering as a Systems Problem
courses.summary: Build a minimal graphics engine to reason about pipelines, resources, and performance honestly.
